detailed_results.input: The world’s stable now. People are happy; they get what they want, and they never want what they can’t get. They’re well off; they’re safe; they’re never ill; they’re not afraid of death; they’re blissfully ignorant of passion and old age; they’re plagued with no mothers or fathers; they’ve got no wives, or children, or lovers to feel strongly about; they’re so conditioned that they practically can’t help behaving as they ought to behave.
detailed_results.prediction: (stable & happy & get_what_they_want & G(!want_what_they_cant_get) & well_off & safe & G(!ill) & G(!afraid_of_death) & ignorant_of_passion & ignorant_of_old_age & G(!has_mother) & G(!has_father) & G(!has_wife) & G(!has_children) & G(!has_lovers) & G(behave_as_they_ought))
detailed_results.reasoning: The prediction preserves the original meaning by maintaining the same properties and conjunctions, albeit in a more detailed and explicit form. The absence of an explicit coalition in the prediction does not alter the semantic meaning, as the context implies a global or universal perspective, akin to 'World'. The use of the G (always) operator is also consistent with the gold standard, ensuring that these conditions hold true at all times, aligning with the description of a stable world where people's needs and wants are consistently met without fear, illness, or strong emotional attachments. The prediction's structure, though more verbose, encapsulates the same temporal logic and intent as the gold formula.
